articles.title: US coronavirus death unsettles Seattle, raises response questions
articles.description: Medical experts say the coronavirus has probably been circulating undetected in the US for some time.
articles.content: Seattle, United States - It took less than a month after China alerted the World Health Organization to the emergence of a new coronavirus in the country for the infection to cross the Pacific Ocean, and another month for it to claim its first life in the Uni… [+7204 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Grim economic forecasts as coronavirus spreads
articles.description: The world's peak economic body, the OECD, says coronavirus could make the global economy shrink for the first quarter since the 2008 financial crisis.
articles.content:
The world's peak economic body, the OECD, says the new coronavirus could make the global economy shrink for the first quarter since the 2008 financial crisis.
Already China's manufacturing sector says factory activity hit record lows in February.
But the ef… [+105 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: US coronavirus death toll rises to 6
articles.description: Four more deaths reported in Washington state, where officials had previously said two people had died from the virus.
articles.content:
Four more people have died in the US state of Washington after being infected with the coronavirus, bringing the death toll in the state and country to six, authorities said on Monday.
Dr Jeff Duchin, chief health officer for the Seattle and King County Publ… [+2433 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: South Korea church leader apologises over coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: South Korea has the largest number of infections outside China, with the total rising to 4,335.
articles.content:
The leader of the church at the centre of the coronavirus outbreak in South Korea has publicly apologised for the first time.
South Korea has the largest number of infections outside China - at 4,335.
Al Jazeera's Rob McBride reports from the capital, Seoul.

articles.author: Kate Mayberry
articles.title: Algeria, Egypt confirm more coronavirus cases: Live updates
articles.description: Spread of virus outside China continues to accelerate as governments step up efforts to contain infections.
articles.content:
Hello and welcome to Al Jazeera's live updates on the new coronavirus as it continues to spread from its epicentre in central China to countries around the world.
I'm Kate Mayberry in Kuala Lumpur, taking over from Mersiha Gadzo.

articles.title: Kenya needs to stop panicking and start preparing for coronavirus
articles.description: We should stop wasting time trying to stop the virus from entering Kenya and start preparing for the outbreak instead.
articles.content:
Kenyans are a worried lot. As the coronavirus outbreak continues to spread across the globe, there are increasing questions being raised about the measures - or more accurately, the lack of measures - the government is taking to protect the population.
